author: Mohammed Iqbal
text:
The killing of Shankar, a 22-year-old Dalit, who was hacked to death in full public view at Udumalpet in Tirupur district of Tamil Nadu on Sunday, has caught the attention of the National Human Rights Commission, which has taken suo motu cognisance of the incident.

The Commission on Monday took cognisance of reports about the attack by three motorcycle-borne men with sickles and sharp weapons, who killed V. Shankar. He had married a girl belonging to a higher caste last year.

The NHRC has issued notices to the Tamil Nadu Chief Secretary and Director-General of Police, calling for a report in the matter within four weeks. The Commission observed that the incident had raised serious questions about the safety of those belonging to the so-called lower castes in the country.

As the youth, belonging to a Scheduled Caste, had married caste Hindu girl, the matter was known to the police. However, the police failed to provide adequate security to the couple, observed the Commission.
title: NHRC notice to Tamil Nadu
